title: Aphelios has about a 90% pick ban rate in master+
body: Been here for a month now, and he is obv. a terribly designed champion. He feels awful to play and play against. For the first time in 10 years, I actually think a champion should be removed from the game.

replies.body: Classic CertainlyT design, overpowered and with a trillion mechanics.

Oh but come on, he's so hard to master. You should be able to do insane plays with such complicated champions due to the skill ceiling being so high. Just like his other projects like Yasuo & Akali.
/s

Numbers aren't the issue with Aphelios. There's a whole host of design components in his kit that are flagrant "fuck yous" to people. Things like the shotgun turret, the chakrams, the Caitlyn ult as a basic ability, the hard CC in an ADC kit, etc.

Also, Balance doesn't touch champions in production. Champions in production are balanced by their design team. Only when they hit live servers do they come under the jurisdiction of the balance team.

That said, I do agree that as a preliminary designer, CT's fine. I just think none of his designs should ever make it to live without first being vetted hardcore by his production managers and culled and trimmed by other members of his design team. CT's largest problem as a designer is that his overly ambitious designs are not given the proper oversight and revisions to be functional on live servers.

Really, whats the #1 thing that has happened to him? Infernum R numbers being tuned because it was one shotting teams. Thats a number problem more than a design problem. I bet the version the playtest team got was less explosive than the one on live right now.
The range was a numbers problem yes, but the range of his splash damage was but one problem he has. Furthermore, people also claimed numbers could fix Kalista too, and look what happened to her.
CertainlyBroken designs single player gamer fantasy champions, not champions fit for a PvP game.

I agree. Aphelios is not a champion that should exist in this game. In nearly every game I've played, he's been banned as well, and not even by me.

Something simply being strong doesn't justify removing it. Especially not when it's barely been out.

That's what patches are for, to **balance the fucking champion**. If Riot deleted instead of balancing, there'd be literally nothing left in League.

I disagree with this. It's not even that Aphelios is just strong. It's that his entire "kit" is fundamentally not cohesive with this game at all. It breaks far too many rules, especially since he chooses free stats on leveling instead of abilities. He's also going to be a clusterfuck of a balance nightmare on account of how he's designed. When they change items, he's got so many moving parts of his kit that it will have volatile impacts on how he operates. There's no way to simply pull him back in line with item changes, he will always need to be specifically balanced to accommodate the overly diverse nature of his kit. That kind of scope he represents isn't good for this game.

And fine, don't delete Aphelios. But do delete that orgy clusterfuck of a kit and replace it with something else. I'm not even really sure why they believed we needed a champion in the game who's literally a mash up of like 5 other champion kits and playstyles to begin with. The only unique thing he brings to the table is his chakrams, and even those things are probably one of the most abusive parts of his kit.

> he chooses free stats on leveling instead of abilities.

wow its like future patches could change that
Can it? It's pretty fundamental to his design that he doesn't choose skills on level up, so unless he gets nothing except his ultimate at level 6, how would this change?

If you give him an E ability. Loco suggested a reload ability so you could hold onto the gun you want longer. He made the drawback be the time between getting a new gun is increased massively. I like his idea. What really just needs to happen is the obvious power discrepancy between the guns gets lowered so people can pick and choose what gun to use and not have to bother with needing spam certain combos that are god tier (Sev Cres for example).

Hell no. Aphelios already has too much going on in his kit now. One of his supposed weaknesses is that he's forced to change weapons, so I do not see how giving him a reload function is going to make him better. The shot gun and chakram are already bad enough, and this proposal of a reload function to allow him to hold onto them indefinitely is just absurd, as is the notion that he should be able to pick and choose the guns he wants. Giving him MORE control over his kit is probably the most detrimental suggestion of a "fix" for Aphelios' atrocious design.
did you not hear the thing I put in there that mentions "lowers the obvious power discrepancy between the guns"? That means the guns would be toned down.

There's only so much power discrepancy you can lower, as a lot of the function of his weapons is not in the numbers. Plus, you can't actually escape the numbers, because his items will STILL make his guns offensive terrors, especially for things like the CC cannon, shotgun, turrets, and Caitlyn ult.

You can in theory claim you can tone down his weapons, but there is a bottom limit. In the end, he would still have the capability to hard CC you and then blast you to bits, or chuck down 2 turrets and put you in Heimerdinger hell.

i'd say having a 30% slow that lasts for 3.5 seconds, as one of his basic attacks, counts as a pretty decent form of CC.  I'd say having a cone attack that does 75-100% damage (to champions) on a basic attack (without items) is pretty decent form of soft CC.

It might be fine if he had a "bad" gun or two.  But he doesn't all of his passives off them are good to amazing.  650 attack range is pretty nice, 7% life steal sound good to me, 30% slow with 3.5 second duration (got to love passive slows), 110% attack damage with a cone effect that does 75-100% damage to secondary champions (that can crit)= top notch, the ability to attack every .25 seconds with a possible bonus of 30-363% damage (that can crit).

Even without the bonus 100 attack range, it's not like he has to get hyper close to auto attack.

Its the same with Yasuo and Akali and Riven an a bunch of "skill" champs.

He just has too many extra hidden convenience strengths that he just doesn't need.

For example, his Crescendum Q trap.  If you throw it out, enemies can't even attack it at all until they walk into its range.  I get it, it would be frustrating to be new at Aphelios, throw out a trap and have it simply be killed by a longer ranged opponent.  But why couldn't they just have left that in as a weakness of Crescendum?  It's not supposed to be good at longer ranges anyways!

Funny how people will still tell you "the problem with Yasuo is that you are Bronze". The same bullshit since season 3; when Yasuo was released I was unranked, not level 30 yet, and I could clearly tell that his kit was overloaded and badly designed. 

People in Diamond and Challenger ban Yasuo because they are noobs, clearly. {{sticker:sg-lulu}}

I'm tired of the new champions they release.

They either need to give us more ban slots or start adding counterplay to champions they release again.

We always get these new champions now that are just impossible to balance because they have no weakness. If a champion becomes a must ban, you did something wrong Riot. It's time to understand that instead of being stubborn.

In 6 months Aphelios is going to fall off because they'll gradually cave, and start significantly nerfing him, but he's always going to be BS. Nobody is ever going to want to see him buffed. It just leaves a bad taste in everyone's mouth and is a waste of time.

Just because we tolerate Yasuo does not mean they should keep making overloaded champions. There's starting to be too many that are active in the meta.

Grav cannon is his most unnecessary and toxic component of his kit. Change the root to an empowered slow and it instantly resolves a lot of his free kiting and trading patterns. 

From there, cull the CertainlyT trademarked superfluous mechanics like getting a free overheal shield and MS buff, and give his flame thrower the same drawback as {{champion:222}}'s rocket launcher autos with slower attack speed.

After that it's just getting damage numbers balanced with the rest of the ADCs.

>, I actually think a champion should be removed from the game.

Oooooooooorrrr, a ***MUCH*** more reasonable alternative would be, you know...nerfs?

Why the fuck is the board's first reaction to anything being strong to revert or remove it? Like, jesus fucking christ, that's what balance changes are for. They're to ***balance the fucking champion***. If Riot removed shit as soon as it was strong there'd be no fucking League, because everything would have been removed immediately.

Also, [he doesn't](https://u.gg/lol/champions/aphelios/build/?rank=master_plus). Yeah, it's high, but there's quite a big difference between 75% and 90%.

EDIT: Yeah, I misread. Pick+Ban, not just ban. ***Regardless***, a champion being strong ***IS NEVER*** justification to outright delete them. It's called a fucking balance patch.

Because IT IS A BAD DESIGN.

Why remove a seat belt design from a car that has killed 20% of those using it.  Just change the color of it and the buckle shape.  Then it will be good.

NO you scrap the belt.

***i DON'T LIKE IT SO IT ABSOLUTELY FUCKINGH AS TO BE REMOVED RIGHT NOW***.

\- You, 16 hours ago.

What you do is you fucking redesign the belt. You don't scrap the entire fucking car model, you **replace the faulty belts**. Much like with a champion, you don't fucking delete them, you ***rebalance them***

you know there's a saying for this very response right

you don't go about reinventing the wheel lightly

Seat belts are designed to be safe and mostly convenient.  If you made a completely new design and it is faulty, it wastes time and money to continue to try and "improve" what has already worked before

if there is a minor detail that can be corrected, fine, but if you have to re-invest time and research money into fixing new problems, things get expensive, especially in games with a model like league

Aphelios is one of the most conservative models they have used in a while, yet he still has various levels of overkill in his kit that better players have been able to find and point out their flaws for the health of the game

I believe someone mentioned that he had over 1000 individual possible animations based on his combination mechanics, which makes him difficult to market.  He has tools for most situations (which also makes it difficult to balance)

and if you really want to know that they just went overkill....it's possible to hit with over 1000% AD damage at level 6...

Yeah. So, the seatbelt is the problem.

So...Replace the seatbelt (the problematic part of the kit), not the entire fucking car (the champion).

>I believe someone mentioned that he had over 1000 individual possible animations based on his combination mechanics

Unless that person's a Rioter, I'd take that with a bucket of salt. 1k animations for 5 guns doesn't add up, no matter how you combine the guns. And most of those animations will be similar, so you can copy-paste a significant chunk and change what you need to.

Yeah, it'd be longer for him than other champions, because of those combinations, but 1k animations sounds highly suspect.
